For far too long America’s seniors and sick have been getting robbed at the pharmacy counter. Yesterday, @HouseDemocrats passed landmark legislation to #LowerDrugCosts. Now, the Senate needs to stop obstructing and start legislating #ForThePeople! https://cleaver.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/house-of-representatives-passes-major-legislation-to-lower-prescription …

Thank you to everyone who participated in my Tele-Townhall this evening. We discussed everything from prescription drug pricing to voting rights to the dismantling of the CFPB. It is critical that I hear directly from constituents, so I'm thankful for your input! pic.twitter.com/kQrBlIhGx4

Did you know that over 500,000 Missourians live with diabetes? 

They spend anywhere from $1,200 to $20,000 on insulin medication annually.

Under the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act, they could spend up to 3.5x less on these essential medications. pic.twitter.com/jyNaaYE1w3

In just 4 years, the cost of insulin DOUBLED. 

That's ridiculous. 

The medicine you need to stay alive shouldn't cost an arm & a leg. Dems are serious about tackling the skyrocketing cost of prescription drugs & we’re committed to passing our bill, the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act.

If you were wondering why @HouseDemocrats are passing legislation to #LowerDrugCosts this week, consider this:
Americans prescribed Humira typically pay 576% MORE per dose for their medication than people in other countries. pic.twitter.com/QJY2G9heRd

Those who enroll in CRP receive annual rental payment for voluntarily establishing long-term, resource-conserving plant species to control soil erosion, improve water quality and develop wildlife habitat on marginally productive agricultural lands.

Farmers and ranchers have a chance to enroll in the Conservation Reserve Program for the first time or continue their participation for another term – beginning 12/9. To enroll in CRP, contact your local FSA county office or visit  http://fsa.usda.gov/crp

I may be old-fashioned, but I want to believe that no President would ever stoop to the level of placing our national security below political posturing. However, President Trump continues to attack the process and nonpartisan public servants, while leaving the facts uncontested.
Having said that, my hope is that the President will allow White House officials to come forward and provide any exculpatory evidence that might address these fact-based allegations.

The conduct outlined in this report should have every American deeply concerned. It lays out how the President misused taxpayer-funded military aid to coerce a foreign government into smearing a domestic political rival to benefit his re-election in 2020.
